item.title: Track into woodland heavily littered, 14th September
item.description:
The track leading from Rookery Lane into Scronginghill Wood is heavily littered - litter lines either side of the track, caught in undergrowth, on both sides of wire fence on the right as you enter woodland. Please can you attend and conduct thorough litterpick.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rookery Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Absolutely revolting smell of rotting flesh just by the coop funeral place, 14th September
item.description:
If you go past the mcdonalds on woolwich church street towards woolwich there is a revolting smell of rotting flesh that has been getting worse and worse for about a month now. i wonder if the funeral care home is disposing of its medical waste correctly or if it is the drains that stinks because of them. either way it smells horrific and needs investigating asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Church Street, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags, 14th September
item.description:
Numerous flags to an unnecessary level meant to be intimidating and decisive. The comment on your website that it is not causing community issues is false, and irrelevant since it is against the 1980 Highways Act. Taking no action suggests it is not necessary to abide by the laws
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Traffic control by priority system and wider pavement required, 14th September
item.description:
Issue: As per the SRA Road Safety Working Group proposals already submitted for 'Speeding', vehicles are often being driven too fast down Glassmill Lane into Queens Mead Rd and at the gate to/from the park where the pavement is very narrow, making it dangerous for pedestrians trying to cross the road. Requirement: Widen the pavement near the gate for the park and install a traffic control by priority system, giving priority to those vehicles travelling uphill towards Bromley.. This would still allow emergency vehicles to pass and slow other traffic down and make it safer for pedestrians to cross the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glassmill Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Install traffic island & reduce exit to one lane, 14th September
item.description:
Issue: As per the SRA Road Safety Working Group already submitted for 'Pedestrian Crossings', there is currently no crossing for pedestrians to get across Ravensbourne Ave, which is 3 lanes wide at the junction with Beckenham Lane. Requirement: Reduce the exit from Ravensbourne Ave to one lane (maintaining the one for entry) and install a new traffic island in the middle of the two lanes at a safe distance back from the traffic lights to ensure overheight vehicles turning right from Beckenham Lane into Ravensbourne Ave have sufficient clearance. This would provide a refuge for pedestrians to cross safely in 2 stages with no interruption to traffic flow.. A separate request will be raised to re-sequence the traffic lights to stagger the timing with the lights at Station Rd with those here, neither of which are on bus routes (except when on diversion).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
